member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.DebuggerEvent
T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.AtBreakpointEvent
member.summary:
This event is generated whenever a breakpoint is reached. This event has the following data:
- breakpointId: id of the breakpointable object where the thread has been suspended. - stack: thread's stack at the moment it was suspended. The stack includes only breakpoint ids, not the local state (which must be obtained via the debugger's Evaluate method)

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ExceptionThrownEvent
member.summary: This event is generated when an exception is thrown

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ConcurrentAtBreakpointEvent
member.summary: When a request gets suspended in a debug session, this event is sent to all of the other debug sessions so that the users are aware of concurrent debug activity.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ContinueEvent
member.summary: This event is generated whenever a thread exits from its suspended state. It is used by Service Studio to update the thread's state and debugger buttons status.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.BeforeSuspendEvent
member.summary: This event is generated whenever a thread receives a request to be suspended but before it reaches a breakpoint.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadEndEvent
member.summary: This is event is generated when a thread ends. It is used by Service Studio to remove the thread from the threads list.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadHandledByAnotherUserEvent
member.summary: This is event is generated when a thread is handled by an user and sent to all other connected users. It is used by Service Studio to remove the thread from the threads list.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.LoggedInUsersChangedEvent
member.summary: This event is generated whenever the list of logged in users changes. It is used by Service Studio to update the list of concurrent debug sessions

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.StopDebugSessionEvent
member.summary: This event is not specific to a given thread. It is used to signal that the debug session has been stopped by Service Studio. It is used to notify all attached Service Studios that they must update their UI in order to show that the session is closed.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ApplicationIsBeingRedeployedEvent
member.summary: This event is sent when the debug session is being stopped by the server because the app is being redeployed. SS will then try to reconnect.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.DebugSessionStartedEvent
member.summary: This event is sent when the debug session is has been successfully started.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadData
member.summary: This class is used to collect data about a suspended thread. It provides methods to command the thread and also to obtain data about it.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadData.LongLivedRequestData
member.summary:
This class is used to store info on a request that must be available for long-lived requests. E.g., when debugging a process we're actually running in different requests over time, but we want it to work as if it was a single request, namely wrt the StepOver/Out/etc behavior.
Note that the data here is not specific to long-lived requests - for regular requests we also need this data, but the difference is that we won't store it to reuse for later requests

member.name: P:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadData.ClientRequestToken
member.summary: Token sent by client (browser) to identify this request

member.name: P:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.ThreadData.ClientSideCallContextId
member.summary: CallContextId used to identify the client thread associated

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.StackManager
member.summary: This class is used to keep track of the call stack of a given thread.

member.name: T:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.LocalState
member.summary:
This class contains information about a given element in the thread's call stack. This info includes:
- eSpaceName: the name of the eSpace we're in. This is useful when debugging Producer/Consumer eSpaces, since different elements in the stack may correspond to different eSpaces. It is used by Service Studio to provide feedback on the breakpoints that are not in the currently open eSpace.
- functionId: id of the function we're in. This is a BreakpointId.
- functionName: name of the function. See comment on eSpaceName.
- breakpointId: id of the breakpointable object where the thread is suspended
- vars: value of the local variables by the time the thread was suspended. This enables us to evaluate expressions.

member.name: P:OutSystems.HubEdition.RuntimePlatform.Email.EmailProcessor.MailUA
member.summary: String for RuntimePlatform to use as UserAgent on HTTP Requests

Initializes the production of an email message, creating its headers and main body. Note that this action does not immediately send the message, as you may want to add futher parts (attachments) to it (using ). To finalize message and send it you should then call RichMailSend
member.remarks: Older emails clients (such as some versions of Lotus and Outlook 2000) do not correctly support the MIME encoding used to send HTML emails. To enable HTML emails to be delivered correctly to these clients you can add "lotus/compatible" (without the quotes) to the ContentType. This will change how the whole email is created and allows those clients to shows the message properly at the expense of more recent email clients (such as Yahoo! Mail) that will not display the message correctly.
member.param: Email addresses to send the email to (comma separated)
Email addresses to carbon-copy the email to (comma separated)
Email addresses to blind carbon-copy the email to (comma separated)
Character used in the message text
TRUE if content of the message is HTML rather than plain text
Base URL to use in case the Body is HTML. This allows any relative paths that may exist in the Body to be expanded to full blown URL's
If TRUE, any images referenced via an URL in the Body are attached to the message
User agent to use to request the email messages.
The hostname to use when building links in the email body.
System marker that should be passed in to any further parts that are added to this message (see ).
The full message text produced by the call

List of BinaryImageInfo. This list contains the information required to add extra image parts at the end of the email. When using this parameter make sure your ssBody already contains the cid:guid information.

member.summary: Summary description for serverlog.

members.member:
It should be ok to truncate the hash to a shorter length since we are not worried about collisions here, just trying to force different hashes when the content is updated.
FIPS 180-4 (http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/fips/fips180-4/fips-180-4.pdf) specifies that: "Some application may require a hash function with a message digest length different than those provided by the hash functions in this Standard. In such cases, a truncated message digest may be used, whereby a hash function with a larger message digest length is applied to the data to be hashed, and the resulting message digest is truncated by selecting an appropriate number of the leftmost bits".

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.Session.GetUserFromSessionCookie
member.summary: Based on the session cookie from the current HTTP request, this method will look in the session database for the UserId of the user currently logged in the user provider of the application that calls this method. Will return 0 if: There is no session cookie on the HTTP request. There is no user logged in with the same session cookie. There is a user logged in, but only in a different user provider.
member.returns: The UserId of the user currently logged in.

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.Session.GetMobileAppLoginInfo(System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets User information of the authenticated user for a Mobile Application This method is designed for interoperability scenarios where you need to embed a Responsive screen in your mobile application
member.param: Returns the user identifier, or NullIdentifier() (userId = 0) if user is not logged in
True if the login is persistent

member.name: M:OutSystems.RuntimePublic.Session.GetMobileAppLoginId(System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the token that uniquely identifies the authenticated session for a Mobile Application This method can be used in when managing server side session stores where you need to uniquely identify a user authenticated session
member.param: Returns the session identifier or NullTextIdentifier() if no user is logged in
